intro: Lastrea laxa, commonly known as the slender lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Lastrea laxa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
